doc.after: The iPad's (first two generations) touchscreen display is a 1,024 by 768 pixel, 7.75Ã5.82Â in (197Ã148Â mm) liquid-crystal display (diagonal 9.7Â in (246.4Â mm)), with fingerprint- and scratch-resistant glass. Steve Jobs said a 7-inch screen would be "too small to express the software" and that 10Â inches was the minimum for a tablet screen.[61] Like the iPhone, the iPad is designed to be controlled by bare fingers; normal, non-conductive gloves and styli do not work,[62] although there are special gloves and capacitive styli designed for this use.[63][64]
